summary: "Princess Elia was a good woman, Your Grace. She was kind and clever, with a gentle heart and a sweet wit. I know the prince was...
body:
“Princess Elia was a good woman, Your Grace. She was kind and clever, with a gentle heart and a sweet wit. I know the prince was very fond of her.”

~ Barristan Selmy to Daenerys Targaryen

[Elia Martell and Rhaenys Targaryen | Fanart by Sam18_Artworks]

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: The Beginning of the End - Chronicler - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Beginning of the End - Chronicler - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Summary:  

Nine years old, and there’s one thing that Theon Greyjoy knows for sure: he doesn’t want to be sent across the ocean to live with the Starks. They sound all proper and scary.

Besides, he’s not meant to know, but he knows, that if his father misbehaves then Lord Eddard Stark will cut Theon’s head clean off his body. And King Balon Greyjoy is known for misbehaving. It won’t matter that Theon’s supposed to be a prince, he’ll be just another mutilated little body hung over the gates of some faraway town.

Lord Stark has a dozen children of his own, they say, legitimate and bastard. How will Theon fit in with them? It’ll be all lessons with their maester and fancy parties. And what if they’re mean, what if they bully the prisoner stranded inland? He doesn’t want to leave his own sister, Yara, either. Yes, she’s terrifying, but she kisses his forehead sometimes, and says she’ll watch out for him.

But out there? Out where the Drowned God can’t hear him anymore. Anything might happen…

Notes: 

Thank you to Matty for beta reading.

Rating:

  • Teen And Up Audiences

Archive Warning

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

Category:

  • Gen

Fandoms:

  • Game of Thrones (TV)
  • A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
  • A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms

  • Yara Greyjoy
  • Asha Greyjoy

  • Angst

  • LGBTQ Themes
  • Foreshadowing
  • Siblings

Language:English Stats:Published:2019-03-14 Words:649 Chapters:1/1

summary: 'going by past seasons sansa is going to have one of the longest screen times' why do you think that? sophie was filming even...
question: 'going by past seasons sansa is going to have one of the longest screen times' why do you think that? sophie was filming even less than actors who play lyanna and missandei for s8. i suppose we won't even see her in some episodes. it will be kit's and maisie'e season. they were on the set ton of time. emilia right after them
answer: sansa has the fourth most screen time out of all the characters in the past seven seasons. she was the protagonist of the winterhell storyline last season and she still finished early. her scenes don’t require a lot of action which takes time to set up and execute. literally since the sixth season people have used the fact that sophie finishes filming quicker than kit and maisie to claim she’ll die or she won’t be in many scenes. besides both kit and maisie filmed two massive battle sequences that took weeks to finish, sophie doesn’t need to do that. since last year we were told that sansa was the mvp of the season and i’m choosing to trust that.

body:
Of Emperors, Empresses and Vagabonds

Now that project blue book season 1 is officially finished, I am going to miss the Hynek/Quinn ship a lot, so my befuddled brain has decided to do a little cross-over with my GOT Roman fic by “borrowing” Quinn and placing him in the story as a Roman general loyal to Ned Stark. I have posts 1 &2 of the upcoming chapter Poison finished, and will introduce him in post 3 (looking forward to writing that!). Petyr needs a friend!

summary: I glad someone else sees how stupid got fans are both the show and the books (it's even funny these ones think the show fans are...
question: I glad someone else sees how stupid got fans are both the show and the books (it's even funny these ones think the show fans are stupid but they're just as stupid even worse b/c they're smug in their stupidity). I only care about Sansa from this series since I don't watch or read it and I have to say these fans have got to be the dumbest bunch I've ever seen.
answer:
I have honestly never encountered a fanbase that is almost wholly unintelligent like this one. Even if they liked Sansa, they’d be stupid because they don’t understand any of the characters. The reason D&D can get away with so many plot holes and inconsistencies is because the fanbase isn’t perceptive. It took season 7 ep 6 for them to finally call bullshit and most of them still thought it was a good season. I am so baffled by the comments that they make.

The ASOIAF fandom is a different kind of stupid, the smug kind but it’s like they are reading a wholly different book series than the rest of us. The way they interpret the text is so damn wild.

summary: I don’t like the Sansa and Arya duo either and I’m an Arya Stan. I like Sansa tho I just don’t feel like their scenes add...
question: I don’t like the Sansa and Arya duo either and I’m an Arya Stan. I like Sansa tho I just don’t feel like their scenes add anything to either character together they usually bore me while I like them separate.
answer: Exactly! We never learn anything new about either character, the dynamic isn’t rich at all. I really don’t get why people are hyped for more scenes. I’d rather both characters interacted with characters that do develop them. It’s the final season, we really don’t have that much left with them which is why I want it even less. Sansa-Arya scenes are a complete waste of time, probably more than Sansa-Bran and Arya-Bran scenes. At least we know Sansa would hand lordship to Bran if D&D didn’t hate him and Arya was given the dagger that almost killed Bran and that finally killed Littlefinger. Worst of all Sophie and Maisie lack chemistry when they are acting opposite each other but not in real life.
